newsitem.title: USA: Short named Detroit deputy finance director.
newsitem.headline: Short named Detroit deputy finance director.

text.p: - Detroit Mayor Dennis Archer announced Wednesday the appointment of Roger Short as the city's deputy finance director and chief accounting officer.
Short, who has worked for the city for 15 years, will manage Detroit's financial record-keeping, as well as the city's annual audit, according to a news release from the mayor's office.

"I'm looking forward to working with both (Finance Director) Valerie Johnson and Mayor Archer," Short said. "I bring 15 years of experience with the city of Detroit to this job. But more importantly, I bring a commitment to making the finance department more user-friendly."
Short was the city's auditor general from 1985 to 1995. Before that, he was an accountant for Barrow, Aldridge & Co.; the City of Detroit Building Authority; and Arthur Andersen & Co.
